title: 10-year-old shot during family dispute at York home
content:
YORK, Pa. — A 10-year-old is recovering after being shot inside his York home Saturday morning, according to the York Police Department.
Police were called to the home on the 200 block of South Penn Street at 3:45 a.m. for reports of a family shooting turned violent.
Investigators say the incident began when 28-year-old Marquez Jabar McCowan went to the back side of the home and began shooting at a woman inside. Consequently, one of the shots hit the 10-year-old boy in the shoulder. The shooting is believed to be part of an ongoing family dispute, police said in a release.
The boy was taken to York Hospital where he is expected to be okay.
McCowan was not arrested and a warrant has been issued for his arrest.
Anyone with information on the case is asked to call York City Police Department at 717-846-1234 or text a tip to 847-411.
